channel.title: Hello
channel.description:
Hi It's been a long time when I last visited. Recently I was deleting junk and organising folders when I came across a folder with pictures of my old models. That made me spend 30 minutes trying to recover the password for my profile and making something in Metasequoia (I can finally spell it right! :D). Well anyways, here are the 2 models I made.
[img]http://img707.imageshack.us/img707/329/pic1hv.png[/img] [img]http://imageshack.us/a/img13/6600/bow1d.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.us/a/img46/8494/pic2te.png[/img] [img]http://imageshack.us/a/img12/7127/bow2f.png[/img]
Rate, Like or Hate and maybe comment if You have anything to say. :)

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

Im still here and they look good

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

The concepts are good, just enough detail. You should try joining objects together instead of placing them next to or through each other, there is also a little you can do to reduce poly count. Good job, i hope you make more models.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“The Arcanian, post:7, topic:479106”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=597322.msg4205757#msg4205757 date=1358901765]
I can position and make the ints. And no, people aren’t nearly active here as they used to be.
[/quote]
I do believe that you can do the ints and all the positioning and scaling, but Im doing it myself. Making them exactly the right angle and size I want.
I’ll do my best to make this section be as active as it used to be. :)[/quote]Sorry, I just meant - if you need help making the ints I can make some pretty damn good ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I’ve always loved your models.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

the elve age:

I can position and make the ints. And no, people aren’t nearly active here as they used to be.

I do believe that you can do the ints and all the positioning and scaling, but Im doing it myself. Making them exactly the right angle and size I want.
I’ll do my best to make this section be as active as it used to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“The Arcanian, post:3, topic:479106”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=597322.msg4205696#msg4205696 date=1358897874]
Release those, they are very well done. Good job! And - I remember you
[/quote]
Thank You! I will release them later on when I have bunch of models made. Gonna release them in like a model package.
I don’t feel like doing the positioning, scaling and writing the ints for now. I remember you too.
I wonder if the people are still here that where active when I was…[/quote]I can position and make the ints. And no, people aren’t nearly active here as they used to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:479106”]I really like the sword.
But a question, though i am new to modelling.
Why is it that the blade looks like it has jagged edges along the sides of it?
Sorry, I’m a newb at modelling. :)[/quote]
The cause of the edge to display like that is most likely because of the shape of the blade itself. It’s not flat. By the way, Im sure that there isn’t any anti-aliasing feature in Metasequoia 3D view, and the render is soo cheap that it’s just waste of time to render the models with Meta.

Read full topic

Thank You! I will release them later on when I have bunch of models made. Gonna release them in like a model package.
I don’t feel like doing the positioning, scaling and writing the ints for now. I remember you too.
I wonder if the people are still here that where active when I was…
